Participants.evidence: Participants included surgeons who routinely perform high-risk surgery and patients 60 years or older with at least 1 comorbidity and an oncological or vascular (cardiac, peripheral, or neurovascular) problem.

Intervention.evidence: Patients received a question prompt list brochure with 11 questions that they might ask their surgeon.

Objective.evidence: Objective: To quantify the frequency of preoperative ACP discussion and documentation for older adults undergoing major surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: any statement related to ACP from the surgeon, patient, or family member during the audiorecorded preoperative consultation was counted.

Result_Outcome.evidence: there was no significant association between the presence of an AD and patient age (60-69 years, 26 [31%]; 70-79 years, 31 [33%]; ≥80 years, 15 [42%]; P = .55)
